FuncDef:
The protect-switch command configures a manual switch request for a specified PW APS instance.
The protect-switch clear command deletes the manual switch request for a specified PW APS instance.
By default, no manual switch request is configured for a specified PW APS instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates to forcibly switch traffic to the protection path. If the protection path is Down, the configuration does not take effect.
After you specify force, traffic travels along the protection even after the working path recovers.
-

Indicates to lock traffic to the working path. Traffic is not switched to the protection path even if the working path is faulty.
-

Indicates to manually switch traffic to the protection path. If the protection path is Down, the configuration does not take effect.
If the working path recovers after you specify manual, traffic switches back to the working path.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In network O&M, service traffic sometimes needs to be switched to the protection path or locked to the working path. To switch traffic manually, run the protect-switch command.
After maintenance operations are complete, you can run the protect-switch clear command to switch traffic back.
Prerequisites
A PW APS instance has been created using the pw-aps command.
Precautions
Different switch requests have different priorities. When the priority of a new switch request is higher than that of the current switch request, the new switch request takes effect.
